clinical_study.brief_title: DONATE-Pilot Study on ICU Management of Deceased Organ Donors
clinical_study.official_title: DONATE-Pilot Study: Prospective Observational Study of the ICU Management of Deceased Organ Donors

brief_summary.textblock: The DONATE-Pilot is a prospective observational cohort study in organ donation (OD) that observes the ICU management of consented deceased organ donors at 4 high volume centres over a period of 12 months each. The pilot study will be followed by a 1-year prospective national observational study a 15-20 ICUs across Canada.

primary_outcome.time_frame: After 1 year of recruitment at each participating site
primary_outcome.description: This outcome is judged based on four elements: 1) Implementation of a waived consent model; 2) Refinement of data collection procedures for adult intensive care units; 3) Development of efficient links to post-transplantation data.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 1 year of recruitment at each participating site
secondary_outcome.description: A descriptive analysis of various interventions and approaches in the management of deceased organ donors. Adherence to recommendations of the national deceased donor management guidelines.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 1 year of recruitment at each participating site
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as: 1) Number of organs recovered; 2) Number of organs transplanted.

arm_group.description: Data will be collected on deceased donors, declared by neurological determination of death (DND) and by circulatory determination of death (DCD).

intervention.description: Data collection relevant to this study will be obtained by observation and review of hospital charts. Limited data will be obtained through relevant organ donation organizations (ODOs).

study_pop.textblock: All patients for whom consent for deceased organ donation has been obtained.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Admitted to a critical care area (ICU, PICU, CCU, ER)
- Consented deceased organ donors (DND and DCD)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Neonate <36 weeks gestation
